bibl.title: John Bowler and Edward McCrinkle v. James H. Bennett. Complaint, Exhibit E
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: COMPLAINT Before C.D. EMERY, United States Commissioner, Seattle, Wash. No.108
United States of America, Territory of Washington, } ss. City of Seattle
John Bowler of Seattle in the County of King and Territory of Washington, being duly sworn, deposes and says that Edward McCrink

heretofore, to-wit, on the 26th day of June A.D. 1888 at Seattle in said Territory, having duly taken an oath before C.D. Emery ( he the said C.D. Emery being then and there a competenet officer, towit: a United States Commissioner duly commissioned acting and sworn and qualified to administer oaths) that he would testify declare and depose truly in a certain action then and there pending before said Commissioner wherein the United States was Plaintiff and him the said James H. Bennett was defendant, did then and there wilfully corruptly and knowingly contrary to such oath wilfully under oath state and testify that he the said James H. Bennett did on the 15th. day of June A.D. 1888 at the harber of San Francisco in the State of California with brass knuckles make an assault in and upon one John Bowler and him the said John Bowler with said brass knuckles did then adn there beat and wound the said statement under oath so made by him the said Edward McCrink being then adn there a material matter in and upon said hearing and which he the said Edward McCrink then and there believed and knew to be untrue

contraty to the form of the statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the United States of America. Wherefore the siad deponent prays that the said Edward McCrink may be apprehended and dealth with according to law. And, furthermore , the said deponent prays that Willis Edwards, Goe. A. Swan, Frank Wilburton and John Hanson whom he has reason to believe, and does believe, are material witnesses to the subject matter of this Complaint, may be duly summoned to appear and give testimony thereto.
Sworn and subscribed before me this 27 day of June A.D. 1888 C.D. Emery U.S. Commissioner
In the District Court, 3rd Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle
In Re application of John Bowler et al for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
